metadata.title: CVE-2018-16843 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
nginx before versions 1.15.6 and 1.14.1 has a vulnerability in theimplementation of HTTP/2 that can allow for excessive memory consumption.This issue affects nginx compiled with the ngx_http_v2_module (not compiledby default) if the 'http2' option of the 'listen' directive is used in aconfiguration file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-lua - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
nginx - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
nginx-common - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
nginx-core - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
nginx-extras - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
nginx-full - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
nginx-light - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.0-0ubuntu1.2').
